SEARCH
Module com.example
Package com.example.data

Class WorkShift

java.lang.Object
com.example.data.WorkShift
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class WorkShift extends Object implements Serializable
The WorkShift class represents a work shift with a start time, end time, settings, work hours, and pay. It provides methods for retrieving the start time, end time, settings, work hours, and pay, as well as modifying the start time, end time, and settings of a work shift. The class also calculates the work hours and pay of a work shift based on its start time, end time, and settings. WorkShift objects are serializable.
Author:
Matti Voutilainen

    • WorkShift

      public WorkShift(LocalDateTime start, LocalDateTime end, Settings settings)
      Constructs a new WorkShift object with the specified start time, end time, and settings. Calculates the work hours and pay for the work shift based on the start time, end time, and settings.
      Parameters:
      start - the start time of the work shift.
      end - the end time of the work shift.
      settings - the settings for the work shift.

    • modify

      public void modify(LocalDateTime start, LocalDateTime end, Settings settings)
      Modifies the start time, end time, and settings of the work shift. Calculates the work hours and pay for the work shift based on the modified start time, end time, and settings.
      Parameters:
      start - the new start time of the work shift.
      end - the new end time of the work shift.
      settings - the new settings for the work shift.

      private WorkHours calculateHours()
      Calculates the work hours for the work shift based on its start time, end time, and settings.

      The work hours for the work shift.

    • modifyPeriodTo2Days

      private LocalDateTime[] modifyPeriodTo2Days(LocalDate today, LocalTime start, LocalTime end)
      Returns an array of LocalDateTime instances that represent the start and end times for a period of two days, starting from the given today's date and the given start and end times. If the end time is before the start time, the period will overlap between two different days.
      Parameters:
      today - the date representing the start day of the period
      start - the time representing the start time of the period
      end - the time representing the end time of the period
      Returns:
      an array of LocalDateTime instances representing the start and end times of the period.

    • overlapDuration

      private double overlapDuration(LocalDateTime start1, LocalDateTime end1, LocalDateTime start2, LocalDateTime end2)
      Returns the duration in hours of the overlap between two periods of time specified by their start and end times.
      Parameters:
      start1 - the start time of the first period
      end1 - the end time of the first period
      start2 - the start time of the second period
      end2 - the end time of the second period
      Returns:
      the duration of the overlap between the two periods in hours

    • calculatePay

      private Pay calculatePay()
      Calculates and returns the pay for the worked hours based on the hourly wage, evening bonus, night bonus, extra pay, and overtime pay. If there is no overtime, the overtime wage is zero.
      Returns:
      a Pay object representing the calculated pay for the worked hours
